weather_report:
Evening settles over Katy with an easy quiet, the sky mostly open, only a few clouds loitering at the edges and more drifting in by midnight. There’s no sun left to speak of and the UV is essentially nil, so the night reads clean and calm, with decent clarity for a glance at the stars between passing veils. It feels like one of those December nights that invites you to breathe a little slower and listen to the soft machinery of the neighborhood.

Expect a steady, pleasant stretch tonight: fair now, lightly speckled later. A light jacket or cozy sweater will do, the sort of layer you forget you’re wearing until you hang it by the door. If you’re heading out, a short errand, a leisurely dog walk, or a quiet loop around the block suits the mood; if you’re staying in, a cup of tea on the porch or a few pages of that magazine you keep meaning to finish pair nicely with the sky’s gentle half-clouded attitude.
